title: Malekshahi County
text:
Malekshahi County () is a <a href="counties%20of%20Iran">county</a> in <a href="Ilam%20Province">Ilam Province</a> in <a href="Iran">Iran</a>. The Malekshahi tribe is the biggest Kurdish tribe in Ilam. The capital of the county is <a href="Arakvaz">Arakvaz</a>. It was separated from <a href="Mehran%20County">Mehran County</a> in 2008. At the 2006 census, the county's population was 31,393, in 5,722 families. The county is subdivided into two districts: the <a href="Central%20District%20%28Malekshahi%20County%29">Central District</a> and <a href="Gachi%20District">Gachi District</a>. The county has three cities: <a href="Arakvaz">Arakvaz</a>, <a href="Mehr%2C%20Ilam">Mehr</a> and <a href="Delgosha">Delgosha</a>. 
The name in Persian language (ملگشاهی) is from old name, Melkishi, a Kurdish tribe spread from Ilam to <a href="Ardahan">Ardahan</a> province in Turkey. There is a <a href="Georgians">Georgian</a> counterpart to this tribe, namely the <a href="Melikishvili">Melikishvili</a>. The Malekshahi of the largest tribes in <a href="Iran">Iran</a>, <a href="Iraq">Iraq</a> and <a href="Turkey">Turkey</a>. Melikshahi Kurdish language and dialect is malekshahi.
